xxl.core.pipes.operators.sorters
Class HeapSorter<I>

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.pipes.queryGraph.AbstractNode
      xxl.core.pipes.operators.AbstractPipe<I,I>
          xxl.core.pipes.operators.sorters.HeapSorter<I>
All Implemented Interfaces:
Pipe<I,I>, Node, Sink<I>, Source<I>, MetaDataManageable<Object,Object>, MetaDataProvider<CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>>
public class HeapSorter<I>
extends AbstractPipe<I,I>

Operator component in a query graph that produces sorted runs of the input stream according to the Replacement-Selection algorithm. For further information see "[Knu73]: Knuth Donald E.: The Art of Computer Programming, Vol. III, Sorting and Searching, Addison-Wesley, 1973".

Example usage (1): 

        HeapSorter sorter = new HeapSorter(
                new RandomNumber(RandomNumber.DISCRETE, 100000, 0), DEFAULT_ID, 
                1000, ComparableComparator.DEFAULT_INSTANCE, // max. heap size is 1000 elements 
                true, true
        );
        new VisualSink(sorter, true);

Since:
1.1
See Also:
Heap, Comparator, ComparableComparator

HeapSorter

public HeapSorter(Source<? extends I> source,
                  int sourceID,
                  int size,
                  Comparator<I> comparator)
Creates a new HeapSorter as an internal component of a query graph.
The subscription to the specified source is fulfilled immediately.

Parameters:
source - This pipe gets subscribed to the specified source.
ID - This pipe uses the given ID for subscription.
size - The maximum number of elements that can be stored in the heap.
comparator - The comparator that is used to organize the heap.

processObject

public void processObject(I o,
                          int sourceID)
                   throws IllegalArgumentException
Updates the input counter. Realizes the optimized version of the Replacement-Selection algorithm, that even builds up a new heap based on the same underlying object array.
If the heap is not full, the incoming element is inserted directly. Otherwise, the heap's top element is compared with the incoming element. If the heap is a max-heap, its top element is transferred, if the incoming element is smaller. The top element is removed from the heap and given element is inserted. If the heap's top element is smaller than the given element, the heap flushed and a new heap is built up.

Specified by:
processObject in class AbstractPipe<I,I>
Parameters:
o - The element streaming in.
ID - The ID this pipe specified during its subscription by an underlying source.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - If the given element or ID is incorrect.

done

public void done(int sourceID)
Flushes the buffer, i.e., all elements of the heap are transferred. After that this method calls super.done(ID) and closes the heap.

Specified by:
done in interface Sink<I>
Overrides:
done in class AbstractPipe<I,I>
Parameters:
ID - The ID this pipe specified during its subscription by an underlying source.
